Description:
ArsenalFC.Social is the world's first dedicated Arsenal FC Mastodon Server. This server is the brainchild of 3 Gooners from around the world (US, UK, India) who have pooled their resources, skillsets, and funds to create something that will hopefully become a "home" for Gooners around the world.

Mastodon is a new, growing social media tool that combines some of the best elements of Twitter, Facebook, Reddit, and Instagram and allows a very customisable environment for you to "live" in. Please enjoy your time here and tell your friends!
Short: ArsenalFC.social is the world's FIRST and ONLY Arsenal Football Club-specific Mastodon Server - run BY Gooners FOR Gooners.

Description:
üëã Velkommen

Velkommen til et sosialt nettverk av mennesker som ble f√∏dt, bor og jobber i den norske hovedstaden Oslo.

P√• samme m√•te som andre sosiale nettverk, kan du lage din egen profil, poste meldinger, bilder, meningsm√•linger, videoer og f√∏lge andre medlemmer.

oslo.town eies og drives av mennesker i Oslo. Det er gratis √• bruke og det er ingen reklame. Det er heller ingen store selskaper som pr√∏ver √• overv√•ke hvert eneste trekk du gj√∏r.

Registrer deg n√• for √• kreve ditt unike brukernavn.

üëã Welcome (English)

Welcome to a social network of people that were born, live, and work in the Norwegian capital of Oslo.

Similar to other social networks, you can make your own profile, post messages, images, polls, videos, and follow other members.

oslo.town is owned and operated by people in Oslo. It's free to use and there's no advertising. There's also no big companies trying to monitor your every move.

Sign up now to claim your unique username.

üß¨ How does this work?

Just like a real town there is lots of things happening in your local area. When you are signed up, clicking the Local / Lokal tab will show you everything that is happening on this website. If you want to explore the wider world, click the Federated / Felles tab to see everything happening across a lot of websites connected to this one.

When you see someone interesting, Follow / F√∏lg that person for future updates. They will appear in your Home / Hjem timeline. You can follow anyone in the whole world - whether they are local or not.

When you see something you didn't want to see, you can Mute / Demp or Block / Blokk√©r that person or the whole website. If you see something on the local timeline which you don't think should be on the internet, you can Report / Rapport√©r it to The Mayor.

For a more geeky insight into how the site works, you can watch this YouTube video or read the Documentation.

üèµÔ∏è The Mayor

When you sign up to the website, you will instantly be following @themayor to get the latest updates straight from the oslo.town town hall. It is highly recommended that you follow The Mayor, but it's your life - do what you want - you can always unfollow them.

üß¢ Merchandise

The lovely people at @lokk in Oslo have embroidered a baseball cap.

If you want one, you can go in the store and order one. Ask the for the oslo.town logo (they might need to search their emails for a reference file). Pick out your colour and style of baseball cap. Pay the fine people. And off you go!

üôã FAQ

Who actually runs this site?

The site is run by the user @matt but also pretends to be the character of @themayor. This is also why everything is in English so far - his Norwegian sucks. Sorry about that.

Is this linked to Oslo Kommune?

No. The site is independently run and is not endorsed by Oslo Kommune. The logo of oslo.town is meant to be a parody and tribute to the official Oslo logo, but that is where the link ends. The account @kommune is not currently maintained or monitored by Oslo Kommune.

How much does it cost The Mayor to run oslo.town?

Presently, the main costs are the domain(s), the hosting, and time. But we don't talk about the last one because @themayor is working on a volunteer basis.

  • Domains
    The site is set up on oslo.town which costs 48 GBP per calendar year.
  • Hosting
    The hosting is from masto.host. We currently pay 136 USD per month.
  • Marketing
    Occasionally, oslo.town prints promotional stickers and cards from moo.com which costs 220 NOK per 100 cards, and 240 NOK per 100 stickers. Postage costs not included.

This brings an estimated yearly running cost to a little over 19,000 NOK - which includes domains, hosting, 100 stickers and 100 cards.

How do you pay for this?

We take donations. You can donate via Patreon, Ko-Fi, or PayPal. If you want to send cryptocurrency, you can. And if you are using Brave Web Browser then you can Tip and Contribute through Brave Rewards as you browse the site.

All donations to to the running cost of oslo.town and other projects listed on the Patreon page. The remaining costs are covered by @matt - who is also @themayor.

Why should I use this instead of Facebook / Twitter / etc. ?

Nobody can pretend that oslo.town can replace any popular social networking website, but it's meant to be a nicer alternative. Unlike the big social networking sites, we don't collect your data and sell it. You are not a product. The whole point of this site is community and being able to connect with people locally and globally.

Is my information private?

The goal is to collect as little information about the users as possible and that when information is collected, it is stored for as short time as possible. If you care to, you can read the full Privacy Policy.

To protect your privacy even more, please don't share any personal information with anyone on the site. Think carefully about the username you choose. Share only what you are comfortable sharing.

Please consider how long you wish your posts to be available for. Registered users can set up Automated Post Deletion which will delete your posts after your chosen number of weeks.

Do my posts get listed in Google / Bing / another search engine?

In order to protect your privacy, we have opted-out of listing your profile and toots on search engines. You can turn this on yourself in the settings.

Please be aware that anyone can still screenshot your toots and sites like archive.is or web.archive.org could potentially still create a copy of your publicly listed toots.

How do I only see languages I understand?

When you hit the Federated timeline, you will see many users from around the world speaking their native languages. To filter these views to just languages you know, you should set up the your language preferences.

How do I get featured on the Explore page?

Simple! To get featured on the Explore page, just go to Edit Profile and check the box which says Suggest account to others.

I see offensive content. Can you block it?

If you see an account you see posting offensive content, please use the Block and Report functionality. If this is content that is not hosted on oslo.town then check the option which says Forward to... which will report the account to the appropriate administrator.

Directly from the offensive post, you can also click the option Block Domain which will prevent you from seeing any future content from that website.

We have a set of server rules you should follow. In addition to this, the policy at oslo.town is as follows:

  • We will ensure that bad things don't happen on the Local timeline.
  • We attempt to hide (but not block) any NSFW or spam content from the Federated Timeline.
  • We block any external accounts or domains that are known to frequently spamming our users.
  • Please allow up to 48 hours to process reports.

However, we do not aim to act as your moral compass and will not do domain-wide blocks based on the users of that instance having wild opinions. You should be able to follow anything (even the hidden content) and block these domains or people at your own discretion.

A full list of hidden or blocked domains is published below.

Description:
fAiry.iD is a corner of the vast decentralized federal universe, there is no mandatory topic here, but I hope you will find scientists, engineers, philosophers, musicians, literary scholars, painters, and connect with like-minded people in the federal universe.

We accept and welcome friends from other languages, although most of the active users of this site live in Asia, and the media content is mainly in Chinese.

fAiry.iD pledges to follow the Mastodon 'Server Covenant', in addition to our own moderation 'Server Rules'.All are welcome here!

Description:
Welcome!

This is wetdry.world, a community website running on a custom branch of Mastodon (we call it Chuckya!) focused on gaming, tech, humor, and generally whatever you may be interested in. We are connected to the wider "fedisphere", a large network of thousands of interconnected social websites, which means that a single account here on wetdry.world lets you interact and chat with millions of people from across the entire web!

We host some other stuff here as well:

  • XMPP chat (provided for active members, just ask for an account!)
  • A port of the Akkoma frontend
  • A Tor hidden service
  • More soon...

We also run a sister website with a shared community, lethallava.land, which runs on the Sharkey software instead.

Mobile apps

Mobile apps are available! Any app that works with Mastodon should work, however we recommend these apps in particular because they support the custom features we have:

  • iOS: Feditext (currently in beta, message the linked account to join their TestFlight program!)
  • Android: Moshidon (fork of the official Mastodon Android app, adds many useful/missing features)

Credits

We use resources/custom emoji from the following sources:

  • Blobfox (Apache 2.0), drgn, Neocat, and Neofox (CC BY-NC-SA 4.0) by Volpeon
  • Blobcats by various people, licensed under Apache 2.0
  • Mastodon Modern by Freeplay, licensed under CC BY-SA 4.0
  • so happy smiling cat by puamelia, licensed under CC BY-SA 2.0
  • Neorat by Onemuri

Donate

We don't run any ads, sell data, or charge for usage; the funding to keep this site running comes from optional monthly donations. If you enjoy this place, please consider saying thanks by leaving a tip on Patreon or Ko-fi!

Wet-Dry World, also known as Wet-Dry Land, is the eleventh course in Super Mario 64 and Super Mario 64 DS, and it takes place within flooded ruins, separated into an undeveloped uptown that the player starts in and an underground downtown further into the level. The entrance to the course is the large painting with the Skeeter on it on the Mushroom Castle's second floor. Unique to this course is the ability to raise or lower the water level based on where the painting is entered; the lower the painting is entered, the lower the water level, and the higher the painting is entered, the higher the water level. - Super Mario Wiki
Short: We are a community based around gaming, tech, entertainment, and more! Come join the Scuttlebug jamboree! (Signups currently undergoing manual review.)

Description:
To keep this Project running and up-to-date you can support me on PayPal and Patreon.
There is also external Monitoring by Uptimerobot for this instance

Code of Conduct (TL;DR form)

The one big rule here is "Don't be a dick".

Some more specific rules here are:

  • Respect each other (really, EVERYONE)
  • follow Human Rights (pretty please?)
  • Tag your explicit content
  • Do not use explicit (NSFW, NSFL) avatars and profile headers
  • No commercial accounts (promoting your own work is absolutely ok)


Also some not so specific rules:

  • Please post NSFW content unlisted
  • If you crosspost regularly (or just RTs), please post as unlisted
  • Please don't leave you account alone while crossposting (it could be silcenced)

This list may be extended if needed, so don't push it. If you are deemed violating these rules (or their interpretations), you are subject to moderative actions like silencing or banning

Little addition for Bots

They should:

  • Be marked as such (Bot-Flag)
  • Please post as unlisted

Server is hosted in Germany by Hetzner. So please ... respekt the German laws.


PS: And yep, I mean the 8th ISO/OSI layer :P


Code of Conduct (long form)

Scope and Audience

This policy is for users who have their accounts on layer8.space.

Our instance is only available to users for personal use. Accounts with a commercial background should look elsewhere. Promoting your own work is okay, as long as it is not the focus of your account.



Intent and Remedies

Our guiding principle for remedies is that of intent and willingness to correct ones own behavior. It is okay if you fuck up. But we expect you to correct your behavior as soon as we point it out.

Please approach the moderation team with any issues or questions about this policy, or any other policy in this document. We're always happy to expand in the rationale of these policies and provide advice about being excellent to each other.

If you disagree and reject our requests to fix your behavior, maybe this isn't the right instance for you.



Banned Content

Content that is illegal in Germany is subject to suspensions.



Prohibited Content

We have a zero-tolerance policy against bigoted behavior. This especially includes, but is not limited to racism, sexism, xenophobia, antisemitism, islamophobia and transphobia.

This Instance is sometimes viewed in corporate environments, so all avatars and profile headers should be held in a SFW ("Safe for Work") manner.

Do not argue for the existence or relevance of reverse-racism or reverse-sexism. Racism and sexism are deep structural issues with culture and not the expression of single persons.



Crossposting

Crossposting from other social media accounts like your personal Twitter is considered no problem. But the posts which are visible in the instance timeline should be your own and not something like Retweets.

You also can crosspost retweets, but they should be posted as "unlisted". If you mostly post from twitter, then please also monitor you account over here to see reactions to your posts or other messages.

If we believe that your account is left alone and ist just filling the local timeline, you are subject to be silenced from the local timeline.



Content Warnings

We ask all users to make use of the Content Warning ("CW") feature in Mastodon extensively. While this is a hard requirement for any adult or disturbing content, particularly involving discussion about prohibited content, we highly encourage using it as a general disclaimer regarding the content of your toot.

If someone asks you to add a warning to a particular type of content, it is generally a good idea to follow through.



Personal Pronouns

We encourage you to add your pronouns to your profile if you want them to be used and also check your fellow users profiles for pronouns before engaging in conversation with them.



Discussions and Debate

If you want to start an argument, it is better to ask if the person you're engaging would be interested in hearing your take first. We're trying to build a space where conversations are held in a contructive manner. When you're asked to disengage, do so.



Credit

This (long-written) policies are modeled after deadinsi.de

Impressum

Layer8.Space
c/o COCENTER
Koppoldstr. 1
86551 Aichach

EMail: impressum@layer8.space
Short:
Welcome to the 8th Layer of Madness
Most topics are related to Linux, Anime, Music, Software and maaaany more

PS: BSD is also welcome üòú

Description:
This instance is open to researchers and practitioners in computer systems, including students, faculty, and industry professionals. Systems is broadly defined here -- it includes operating systems, distributed systems, networking, databases, architecture, and more. People in adjacent fields are welcome as well.

Code of Conduct

  • Diversity and inclusion make our community strong. We encourage participation from the most varied and diverse backgrounds possible and want to be very clear about where we stand.
  • Our goal is to maintain a safe, helpful and friendly community for everyone, regardless of experience, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion, nationality, or other defining characteristic.
  • Rules are detailed above. If you are the subject of, or witness to any violations of this Code of Conduct, please contact the administrators. If violations occur, administrators will take any action they deem appropriate for the infraction, up to and including expulsion.

This server is administered by Dan Ports.
Short: Discussion of computer systems research & practice -- OSes, distributed systems, networks, databases, architecture, etc -- for researchers, academics, & professionals.

Description:
Note 1: Please request a new account using your webbrowser, where we explain what we want to know from you.

Note 2: This server will not federate with Meta's (formerly Facebook) Threads, as decided by the community.

Todon.eu is a radical leftist anti-authoritarian Mastodon server. We welcome anarchists, socialists, (climate) activists, the LGBTQIA+ community, environmentalists, anti-racists, anti-fascists, anti-capitalists, intersectionalists, vegans, pirates, human rights activists, etc. As far as they are radical, leftist and anti-authoritarian.

Learn more ‚ü∂

Todon.eu ist ein linksradikaler, antiautorit√§rer Mastodon-Server. Wir hei√üen Anarchist_innen, Sozialist_innen, (Klima-)Aktivist_innen, LSBTQIA+ Personen, Umweltbewegung, Antirassist_innen, Antifaschist_innen, Antikapitalist_innen, Intersektionalist_innen, Veganer_innen, Pirat_innen, Menschenrechtler_innen, etc. willkommen. Solange sie radikal, links √∫nd antiautorit√§r sind.

Mehr erfahren ‚ü∂

Todon.eu es un servidor de Mastodon de izquierda radical antiautoritaria. Damos la bienvenida a anarquistas, socialistas, activistas (clim√°ticos), personas del colectivo LGBTQIA+, ambientalistas, anti-racistas, anti-fascistas, anti-capitalistas, interseccionalistas, veganxs, piratas, activistas por los derechos humanos, etc. Siempre que sean radicales, de izquierdas y antiautoritarios.

Saber m√°s ‚ü∂

Todon.eu is een radicaal linkse anti-autoritaire Mastodonserver. Wij verwelkomen anarchisten, socialisten, (klimaat)activisten, LHBTQIA+-personen, milieubewuste mensen, intersectionelen, antiracisten, antifascisten, antikapitalisten, veganisten, piraten, mensenrechtenactivisten, enz. Als ze maar radicaal, links √©n anti-autoritair zijn.

Let op: Je kunt ipv deze Mastodonserver ook een account aanvragen op onze tweelingserver todon.nl. Deze server heeft meer Nederlandstalige gebruikers, maar wel de dezelfde regels, beheerder en moderatoren.

Meer leren ‚ü∂

Welcome on Todon.eu! Please read first our comprehensive terms of service (including our rules) and our privacy policy.

To give you an idea ‚Äì we do not accept (among other things): racism, homophobia, transphobia, sexism, ableism and other forms of discrimination, harassment, trolling, hate speech, (sexual) abuse of minors and adults (also not virtual), glorification of violence, militarism, nationalism and right-wing populism, right-wing and religious extremism, tankies (ML), capitalists, (right-wing) conspiracy 'theories', hoaxes, and of course no spam and other forms of advertisement.

Want to join us? Tell us exactly why you want to join us! Why especially Todon.eu and not one of the many other Mastodon servers? We especially like to know what kind of leftist political beliefs you have, so that we can see if they are compatible with ours. Just help us to make our job to approve your request easier.

If you don't receive a welcome email in 24 hours, your invite request is (probably) declined.

This Mastodon server is the twin server of Todon.nl. They are both run and moderated by a small collective of volunteers. We accept all languages, although English, Dutch, German and Spanish are the most popular on this server. Moderation is in English, Dutch, Spanish, German, Danish, Swedish and Norwegian.

Features:

  • Character limit of toots: 1312 (instead of 500)
  • Search limit: 11 (instead of 5)
  • Search engine indexing disabled by default
  • Unauthenticated access to public timeline disabled
  • We do not keep unnecessary data

Themes:

  • Todon (Dark - default):
    • in the single column interface the same as the default Mastodon project theme.
    • in the advanced web interface a full width version of the default Mastodon project theme, with some minor modifications (compatible with most screen resolutions, incl. wide screens).
  • Mastodon (Light):
    • the light default project theme
    • full width in the advanced web interface, like the Todon.eu default theme.
  • Mastodon (High contrast):
    • the (dark) high contrast default project theme
    • full width in the advanced web interface, like the Todon.eu default theme.

Willkommen auf Todon.eu! Bitte lies zuerst unsere Nutzungsbedingungen (inklusive unserer Regeln) und unsere Datenschutzerkl√§rung.

Um dir einen ersten Eindruck zu vermitteln ‚Äì wir akzeptieren nicht: Rassismus, homophobes und transphobes Verhalten, Sexismus, Ableismus und andere Formen von Diskriminierung, Bel√§stigung, Trolling, Hassrede, (sexuellen) Missbrauch Minderj√§hrige und Erwachsener (auch nicht virtuell), Gewaltverherrlichung, Militarismus, Nationalismus und Rechtspopulismus sowie, rechten und religi√∂sen Extremismus, tankies (ML), Kapitalisten, (rechte) Verschw√∂rungs'theorien', Hoaxes, und nat√ºrlich Spam oder andere Formen von Werbung.

Du m√∂chtest beitreten? Sag uns genau, warum du unserem Server beitreten m√∂chtest! Wieso hast du dich f√ºr Todon.eu entschieden und nicht f√ºr eine der anderen zahlreichen Mastodon-Instanzen? Insbesondere w√ºssten wir gerne, welchen linken Anschauungen ihr euch zugeh√∂rig f√ºhlt, um zu sehen, ob diese mit den unsrigen kompatibel sind. Diese Auskunft macht es uns leichter, deine Registrierung zu best√§tigen.

Bei uns sind alle Sprachen willkommen, wobei Englisch, Niederl√§ndisch, Deutsch und Spanisch auf dieser Instanz am meisten gesprochen werden. Moderation findet auf Englisch, Niederl√§ndisch, Spanisch, Deutsch, D√§nisch, Schwedisch und Norwegisch statt.

Merkmale:

  • Zeichenbeschr√§nkungen f√ºr Toots: 1312 (anstelle von 500)
  • Suchbeschr√§nkung: 11 (anstelle von 5)
  • Wir speichern keine unn√∂tigen Daten

Farbschemata:

  • Todon (Dunkel - Standard):
    • eine Version des (dunkle) Standardinterfaces von Mastodon in voller Breite (kompatibel mit den meisten Bildschirmaufl√∂sungen, inklusive Breitbild)
  • Mastodon (Hell):

Para darte una idea, no aceptamos (entre otras cosas): racismo, homofobia, transfobia, sexismos, capacitismo y cualquier otra forma de discriminaci√≥n, acoso, trolleo, discursos de odio, abuso (sexual) de menores y adultxs (medios digitales incluidos), glorificaci√≥n de la violencia, militarismo, nacionalismo y populismo de derecha, extremismo de derecha y religioso, tankies (M-L), capitalistas, 'teor√≠as' conspirativas (de derecha), bulos y por supuesto spam ni otras formas de publicidad.

¬øQuieres unirte a nosotrxs? Nos gustar√≠a que te tomaras un tiempo en decirnos por que quieres unirte a nosotrxs. ¬øPor qu√© Todon.eu y no otro de los tantos servidores de Mastodon? Especialmente nos gustar√≠a saber cuales son tus l√≠neas pol√≠ticas de izquierda para saber si son compatibles con las nuestras. Ayudanos a que nuestra labor de aprovar tu propuesta sea mas f√°cil.

Welkom op Todon.eu! Lees eerst onze uitgebreide gebruiksvoorwaarden (inclusief onze regels) en ons privacybeleid.

Om een idee te geven ‚Äì wij accepteren (onder andere) geen: racisme, seksisme, homofobie, transfobie, seksisme, validisme en andere vormen van discriminatie, lastig vallen van mensen, haatzaaien, getrol, (seksueel) misbruik van minder- en meerderjarigen (ook niet virtueel), verheerlijking van geweld, militarisme, nationalisme en rechts-populisme, rechts- en religieus extremisme, tankies (ML), kapitalisten, (rechtse) complot'theorie√´n', hoaxes en uiteraard geen spam en andere vormen van reclame.

Wil je hier een account? Vertel ons precies waarom je je hier wilt aanmelden! Waarom speciaal Todon.eu en niet √©√©n van de vele andere Mastodonservers? We willen vooral weten wat voor linkse politieke overtuiging je hebt, zodat we kunnen zien of deze compatibel is met die van ons. Help ons gewoonweg om onze taak om jouw aanvraag goed te keuren eenvoudiger te maken.

Deze Mastodonserver is de tweelingserver van Todon.nl. Ze worden beiden beheerd en gemodereerd door een klein collectief van vrijwilligers. Wij accepteren alle talen, hoewel Engels, Nederlands, Duits en Spaans het populairst zijn op deze Mastodonserver. Moderatie is in het Engels, Nederlands, Spaans, Duits, Deens, Zweeds en Noors.

Kenmerken:

  • Maximaal aantal tekens voor toots: 1312 (i.p.v. 500)
  • Zoeklimiet: 11 (i.p.v. 5)
  • Indexering door zoekmachines staat standaard uitgeschakeld
  • Ongeautoriseerde toegang tot de openbare tijdlijn is niet toegestaan
  • Wij houden geen onnodige gegevens bij

Thema's:

  • Todon (donker - standaard):
    • in de eenvoudige webomgeving met √©√©n kolom hetzelfde als het standaardthema van het Mastodonproject.
    • in de geavanceerde webomgeving het standaardthema van het Mastodonproject, maar over de volledige breedte en met enkele kleine aanpassingen (compatibel met de meeste schermresoluties, incl. brede schermen).
  • Mastodon (licht):
    • het lichte standaardthema van het Mastodonproject.
    • in de geavanceerde webomgeving over de volledige breedte, zoals het standaardthema van Todon.eu.
  • Mastodon (hoog contrast):
    • het (donkere) standaardthema van het Mastodonproject in hoog contrast.
    • in de geavanceerde webomgeving over de volledige breedte, zoals het standaardthema van Todon.eu.

Description:
Welcome to the ◊ê community!

Hosted and managed in üá´üá∑ France.

First, here are the main ideas behind our rules that should be yours:

  • The respect of others is primary.
  • This instance wants to be peaceful and welcoming.
  • Each user is responsible of their account.

Rules of Aleph.land

You can be suspended for:

  • Sharing content that is illegal in France (pedophilia, mainly).
  • Taking part of a harassment.
  • Putting someone in danger.
  • Having a racist, sexist, discriminating or oppressive talk.
  • Voluntarily degrading the prosperity or the good atmosphere of the instance.

You can be muted from the public timelines for:

  • Posting a media, some text or a link to the following contents without an explicit content warning and NSFW cover:
    • nudity (#nude)
    • gore (#gore)
    • pornography (#porn)
    • a flashy media that could be harmful for photosensitive people (#epilepsywarning)
    • spoil (#spoil)
  • Unpleasant shitposting or flooding.
  • Making abusive ads.
  • Posting automatic toots from another source.

Please keep in mind that these rules are here to guarantee a good experience to everyone on the instance. Also, this list is not exhaustive and moderators will do their best to solve problems that may not have been specified here.

If you have any question, or suggestion, don't hesitate to contact me at @Madeorsk@aleph.land! :)

You can also donate every month to help me to maintain this instance: liberapay.com/Aleph.LAND
Short: A small island of the fediverse. ◊ê

Paquita se adhiere activamente a los principios de la Declaraci√≥n Universal de los Derechos Humanos y la Convenci√≥n de Derechos del Ni√±o.'}, {'id': '51', 'text': 'En semejanza al concepto jur√≠dico de "buena fe", Paquita espera que sus usuarios se atendr√°n en todo momento al esp√≠ritu de la normativa aqu√≠ esbozada y no intentar√°n aprovechar detalles formales de la redacci√≥n de las normas en su beneficio.'}]

Description:
üá¨üáß english version below ‚¨áÔ∏è

Die Mastodon Instanz f√ºr Gamer*innen

Diese Instanz richtet sich in erster Linie an Gamerinnen und Streamerinnen. Bisher gibt es eher wenige Instanzen f√ºr diese Zielgruppe.

Unterst√ºtzen: https://ko-fi.com/vanlueckn

Verhaltensregeln

Neben den unten genannten Serverregeln gilt das Prinzip des "gesunden Menschenverstands". Statt jede Regel auszuformulieren bitten, bitten wir alle Nutzer*innen gut miteinander umzugehen.

Problematisches Verhalten kann jederzeit gemeldet werden und wird schnellstm√∂glich sanktioniert.

Hosting & Zuverl√§ssigkeit

Gametoots.de wird von Personen mit jahrelanger Erfahrung im Hosting von Webanwendungen administriert. Die Instanz wird bewusst nicht auf den "√ºblichen" Servern von Hetzner oder OVH betrieben. Das soll dem Grundprinzip der Dezentralit√§t von Mastodon beitragen.

Der Server wird aktuell bei Hetzner in N√ºrnberg gehostet. Um eine effiziente und einfache Suche zu erm√∂glichen wurde auch Elastic Search aktiviert.

Alle 12 Stunden wird ein Backup der Instanz angelegt und georedundant abgespeichert.

Impressum

Nils van L√ºck
Alte Wember Stra√üe 14
47623 Kevelaer
Germany

E-Mail-Adresse: nils@vanlueck.dev

The Mastodon instance for gamers

This instance is primarily aimed at gamers and streamers. So far, there are rather few instances for this target group.

Support us with the costs: https://ko-fi.com/vanlueckn

Rules of conduct

In addition to the server rules mentioned below, the principle of "common sense" applies. Instead of formulating every rule, we ask all users to treat each other well.

Problematic behavior can be reported at any time and will be sanctioned as soon as possible.

Hosting & Reliability

Gametoots.de is administered by people with years of experience in hosting web applications. The instance is deliberately not run on the "usual" servers of Hetzner or OVH. This is to contribute to the basic principle of decentralization of Mastodon.

Currently the server is hostet by Hetzner in Nuremberg. Elastic Search has also been enabled to enable efficient and easy searching.

A backup of the instance is created every 12 hours and stored geo-redundantly.

Imprint

Nils van L√ºck
Alte Wember Street 14
47623 Kevelaer
Germany

E-mail address: nils@vanlueck.dev

Attribution

This instance uses Mutant Standard emoji, which are licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.

Pepe Emojis by Martlet and Mabaki: https://emoji.gg/pack/3050-essential-pepe-pack

Tor

This instance ist accessible via the Tor network.

To access our Mastodon instance via Tor, simply open the Tor Browser and enter the following address:

http://mnngzcg7eh3mjqmtwbcgna5qtuibazw7zz6v5mvllmkkc6vkt7baenqd.onion

Note: You may need to enable JavaScript in the Tor Browser to fully use all features of the Mastodon instance.

We are committed to providing a safe and secure environment for our users, and we believe that offering access via the Tor network is an important step towards that goal. We hope you will take advantage of this new feature and join us in building a vibrant and engaged community.

Description:
Be pervy, be kind.

A kink, gear, and BDSM-friendly Mastodon instance.

Sign Up

Approval is required for sign-up for anti-spam purposes. Please mention rubber or kink specifically so I can tell you're not a bot. Just a simple "I like rubber" works, even!

Donations

I am not accepting donations at this time. Doing so would have legal and tax ramifications that I'm not prepared for yet. Luckily server costs so far are just "beer money", so please enjoy!
Short: Be pervy, be kind. A kink, gear, and BDSM-friendly Mastodon instance.
rules:

We are a kink-positive and sex-positive community. Though it says rubber in the name, we welcome all types of risk aware consensual kink.'}, {'id': '8', 'text': 'No harassment or abuse.

Racism, misogyny, transphobia, homophobia, or body shaming will not be tolerated.'}, {'id': '9', 'text': 'Keep it legal

No child pornography. Users are assumed to be 18 years old or otherwise legal to view sexual content in their jurisdiction.'}, {'id': '10', 'text': 'Use Content Warnings or Sensitive Content flags.

Since we federate with other instances please mark any media with exposed genitals as Sensitive Content or with a Content Warning. No exposed genitals in your avatar or banner image please.'}, {'id': '11', 'text': "Use the #promo hashtag on ads or commercial posts.

We're excited for kink vendors to participate in our community. That said we'd like to keep it more of a flea market than a mall. Description:
Scholar Social Community Standards

This is a queer-friendly general-purpose federated Mastodon instance. You may use it as a personal account, but the focus is on academics. Scholar Social has been described as "The teacher's break room of the Fediverse."

Real names and credentials are only recommended if you plan to use your account on this instance for networking purposes; they are absolutely not required.

Encouraged uses of Scholar Social

  • Brag about your publications
  • Share references and resources
  • Network with other academics
  • Put it on the last slide of your conference presentation
  • Recruit participants for academic surveys‚Äîformal, IRB-approved ones or even informal ones (just make sure to CW them so that others can consent and don't get too obnoxious about it; see the full Terms of Service for details about other research on Scholar Social members)
  • Satire and activism are welcome here, but they must make a good-faith effort to punch up. ("Punching up": making jokes or criticism at the expense of those with more power, higher status or greater privilege.)
  • Non-academic, "off-topic" stuff is allowed, but try to post this as Unlisted, not as Public

Who is welcome on Scholar Social? Do I need to be a full-time student, teacher or researcher?

The "topic" for this instance is: academia, research, teaching and learning, which is intentionally a very broad topic. You do not need an advanced degree to join (or any degree, for that matter).

If you consider yourself a scholar of any sort, and you are willing to engage with others respectfully, and you will respect our community's efforts to make this a safe space for queer people and other minorities, you are absolutely welcome here.

This instance was specifically started to provide a safe space for queer people and other minorities in academia. Due to the antagonistic relationship that law enforcement has often had with these groups, police officers, military and employees of any law enforcement or intelligence agency are not welcome on this instance.

Introduce yourself!

After signing up, post a message to the Local Timeline telling us who you are, what your academic interests are, and helping us to get to know you better. I have set the administrative account to automatically boost public posts tagged with #introductions. (But if you abuse this by using it for anything else, I will close your account without warning.)

Content Warnings (CW's)

Please add CW's (content warnings) that are accurate and descriptive enough to enable reader consent to the following types of posts:

  • strong language,
  • rants,
  • selfies,
  • current events (includes: US or non-US, local, national, international, and should be applied regardless of whether sources are academic or non-partisan),
  • high-conflict or otherwise exhausting issues of popular debate (e.g. climate change, GMO's, privacy issues, elections, etc.),
  • mentions of death or violence,
  • photographs or illustrations of insects, genitals, wounds (even if they come from a scientific source)
  • references or links to Facebook/Twitter/other big tech companies,
  • spoilers of popular and recent TV shows or other media,
  • ASCII art (this one is important to ensure that someone using a screen reader doesn't have to listen to an attempt to read out a bunch of obscure symbols)
  • stresses particular to academia such as grades, exams, thesis progress, academic job market prospects, and
  • anything else where another user might want to decide for themselves whether or when they want to interact with your post.

There is a setting in your preferences to open all posts with Content Warnings automatically, if you don't want to click through each one.

Image descriptions

It is an expectation of this instance that you add accurate descriptions to all images and video that you post to aid in accessibility. (A description like "image.jpg" that does not aid in accessibility would not meet this expectation.)

If you post an image of a screenshot of text, it is an expectation of this instance that you transcribe the text in the image description.

The Local Timeline

Be conscious of how much space you take up on the Local Timeline. This is the instance's "kitchen table," where we all hang out.

Posts on the Local Timeline (ones with the "Public" privacy setting) will be checked to ensure that Content Warnings are applied, images are described, and other expectations are followed. Unlisted posts will not be proactively reviewed, but will still be subject to rules regarding abuse and other hate-speech.

Make the first post of a thread Public if you want it on the Local Timeline, and subsequent posts Unlisted. We strongly recommend one thread per academic conference, for example.

NOTE: The "official" Mastodon app is NOT recommended for use on Scholar Social, as it does not allow for posting using the "Unlisted" privacy setting.

Use a CW or post as Unlisted if you're not sure that your post is "on-topic." The Scholar Social Local Timeline is not meant to be a current events news aggregator, and if your post seems to fall into this category, you may be asked to delete and re-draft it with a CW or as an Unlisted post. Let's try to avoid turning the Local Timeline into the same rehashing of the outrage-of-the-day that we see on Twitter!

Not every post on the Local Timeline should be CW'd, but most should. Do your best to try to accommodate each other, and try to be understanding when there is a clash of expectations or needs.

Unwelcome conduct on Scholar Social

The following will result in: a warning from the admin or having offending posts deleted, possibly without prior notice.

  • Providing unsolicited advice to strangers
  • Inappropriate un-CW'd posts on the Local Timeline (see above for CW policies)
  • Posts with un-described images or video
  • Shortened links, e.g. bit.ly, t.ly, tinyurl.com, goo.gl, ift.tt, lnkd.in, is.gd or t.co (These are considered malicious because link-shorteners track users without their consent and obscure the destination address, which also prevents users from being able to decide whether they want to visit the link beforehand)
  • Advertisement or apologia for cryptocurrencies, NFT's, or multi-level marketing schemes.

Exceptions:

  • DOI links (e.g. https://doi.org/10.1136/bmj.k959) are allowed but the post must accurately describe the title/author/journal to allow the reader to decide for themselves whether they would like to follow the link. (In cases of very long titles, you may truncate it, and in cases of long author lists, "First-Author et al" will do.) Posts with DOI links where the target of the link is not described, or not described sufficiently, may be deleted without warning.

Things that will get your account closed, possibly without warning

  • Racism, sexism, homophobia, transphobia, able-ism, etc. (will result in a permanent ban, you may not receive a prior warning)
  • Serious dishonesty that is hurtful to others (e.g. falsely representing oneself as a member of a minority; services offering to write academic papers to help students cheat; vaccine denialism; predatory conferences or journals; overt pseudoscience such as flat-earther-ism etc.)
  • Anything that could be described as "spam"
  • Impersonating other people
  • Harassment of any kind
  • No bots and no "institutional" accounts operated by non-members please; Scholar Social is for people
  • Accounts that automatically repeat a Twitter account, RSS feed, etc. must post to Scholar Social as Unlisted, not Public

Regarding attempts to abuse these anti-abuse tools and policies

Do not attempt to weaponize our Community Standards or anti-abuse tools/policies against marginalized groups such as people of colour, women or queer people. Users of Scholar Social are expected to have the literacy to understand that "reverse discrimination" is not real, and so attempts to re-centre discussions of marginalized people around the feelings of the privileged will be taken as manipulative behaviour undertaken deliberately in bad-faith. (E.g. white people should not demand that people of colour put CW's on every discussion of race; a straight person who reports a queer person for writing "I hate straight people" may find their own account suspended.)

Full terms of service
Short: Microblogging for researchers, grad students, librarians, archivists, undergrads, high schoolers, educators, research assistants, profs‚Äîanyone involved in learning who engages with others respectfully

Description:
This server is provided free of charge to all Mastodon users but aims specifically at users in Belgium.

If you really want to donate: paypal @ mastodon-belgium dot be is our official account. At this time we are not actively seeking sponsorship. Sponsoring will NOT give you any benefits or special treatment. Don't say we didn't warn you.
Short: This server is provided free of charge to all Mastodon users but aims specifically at users in Belgium.
rules:
[{'id': '5', 'text': 'Be nice to each other. No shitposting on this server.
Trolls will not be tolerated. Please act in a civilized manner.'}, {'id': '6', 'text': 'No porn, explicit or violent media, racism, sexism, fascism, homophobia, or any other form of abusive behavior, harassment or hate speech.'}, {'id': '7', 'text': 'No incitement of violence or promotion of violent ideologies.'}, {'id': '8', 'text': 'No doxxing of users. Any form of harassment will not be tolerated.'}, {'id': '9', 'text': 'No content illegal in Belgium or, by extension, EU law.'}, {'id': '10', 'text': 'No intentional spreading of fake news, false information or misleading content.
This includes attempts to impersonate Mastodon staff.'}, {'id': '11', 'text': 'No spam or advertising.'}, {'id': '12', 'text': "Politics and religion is tolerated but discouraged. Please use a Content Warning if you do post them.
Whatever your political or religious view may be is your concern but we'd appreciate it if you wouldn't use this platform to plaster it in other people's faces."}, {'id': '14', 'text': "Please don't bring discussions from other Social Media channels over to Mastodon.
If you want to discuss a topic, please do it on the originating side."}, {'id': '16', 'text': "If you're a commercial or government entity or you represent one, please consider hosting your own Mastodon instance.
This instance is set up and paid for by volunteers in order to give users access to the Fediverse.
It's not intended to be used as a commercial or governmental platform."}, {'id': '18', 'text': 'This is a private Mastodon instance, access to this server is a privilege and not a right.
The right to access and/or use this server may be revoked at any given time.
'}, {'id': '19', 'text': "Interpretation of these rules is up to the server's admin discretion and is not open for discussion.
They may change without prior notice."}]

Description:
Organisatorisches

Diese Mastodon Instanz wird von graz.social - Verein zur F√∂rderung ethischer Digitalkultur betrieben. Wir erzielen keinerlei Einnahmen mit dem Angebot und finanzieren uns aus Spenden. Wir behalten uns vor, den Dienst jederzeit aus rechtlichen, technischen oder finanziellen Gr√ºnden einzuschr√§nken oder zu beenden. Dieser Server h√§lt sich an die Vereinbarungen f√ºr Mastodon Serverbetreiber: Server Covenant.

Weitere Informationen zum Verein gibt es auf unserer Internetseite.

Spenden

Unterst√ºtzen kann man uns hier.

Moderation

Diese Instanz wird gemeinschaftlich von mehreren Menschen moderiert, die diese Arbeit rein ehrenamtlich leisten: @oschaumbirne, @linos, @publicvoit und @totoroot

Administration

@ruru4143 und @linos administrieren die Instanz, sprich k√ºmmern sich darum, das alles technisch rund l√§uft.

Empfehlungen und Richtlinien

  • Allgemein gelten die weiter unten angef√ºhrten Serverregeln.

  • Bevor ihr Bilder, Videos oder Ton postet macht Euch bitte Gedanken, ob es einen Mehrwert bietet. Diese brauchen n√§mlich um das hundert- bis zehntausendfache mehr an Speicherplatz. Das verursacht Kosten, die wir als Gemeinschaft tragen m√ºssen. Wenn ihr doch ein Bild hochladet empfehlen wir einen alt-Text hinzuzuf√ºgen.

  • Automatisierte Beitr√§ge und hochfrequente Beitr√§ge sollten nicht gelistet werden (d. h. sie sollten f√ºr alle sichtbar sein, aber nicht in der lokalen Zeitleiste erscheinen), damit die lokale Zeitleiste unserer Instanz ein Ort des Gemeinschaftsdialogs und der menschlichen Interaktion bleibt. Die offiziellen iOS und Android Apps besitzen diese M√∂glichkeit aktuell noch nicht, wegen wir

    • Einsteigern empfehlen, Mastodon zuerst im Browser kennen zu lernen
    • F√ºr iOS Metalab und f√ºr Android Tusky zu verwenden

  • Interpretiert kontr√§re Meinungen anderer so wohlwollend wie m√∂glich. Fragt im Zweifel besser einmal ‚Äûzu viel‚Äú nach, wie etwas gemeint war. Haltet euch vor Augen, dass hinter jedem Blogeintrag, Post, jedem Kommentar usw. ein Mensch steht, der ganz unterschiedlich Lebenserfahrungen gemacht hat

  • Meinungsvielfalt ist ein zentrales Element eines progressiven Diskurses, jedoch l√§sst sich oft kaum vermeiden, dass bei unterschiedlichen Meinungen die Wogen hoch gehen. Wir sind uns bewusst, dass es beinahe zu jeder Angelegenheit zwei v√∂llig widerstreitende Ansichten geben mag. Genau deshalb sollten wir unbedingt R√ºcksicht aufeinander nehmen.

Moderierte Sprachen

Unsere Moderatoren versuchen, unabh√§ngig von politischer Ausrichtung, alle Posts gleichwertig und objektiv entlang unserer Serverregeln zu moderieren. Nat√ºrlich ist das nur f√ºr Sprachen m√∂glich, die wir auch verstehen - daher sind als Sprachen auf unseren Instanzen nur Deutsch und Englisch m√∂glich. Wir behalten uns das Einschr√§nken oder L√∂schen von Nachrichten in anderen Sprachen im Zweifel vor.

Altersgrenze / Minderj√§hrige

Um unsere Dienste verwenden zu d√ºrfen, musst du das 14. Lebensjahr vollendet haben. Siehe dazu auch das Datenschutz-Anpassungsgesetz 2018.

Keine AI / ML Regelung

Es ist untersagt, Daten oder Inhalte von den unten angef√ºhrten Instanzen f√ºr das Training oder die Entwicklung von Modellen der k√ºnstlichen Intelligenz oder des maschinellen Lernens zu verwenden, ohne die ausdr√ºckliche Zustimmung des Urheberrechtsinhabers einzuholen. Jede unbefugte Nutzung von Daten oder Inhalten f√ºr KI/ML-Zwecke wird als Versto√ü gegen das Urheberrecht betrachtet und kann rechtliche Schritte nach sich ziehen.

Impressum

https://info.graz.social/impressum/

Description:
swiss.social wird vom gleichnamigen Verein mit Sitz in Bern zur Verf√ºgung gestellt.

Der Verein ist politisch und konfessionell unabh√§ngig, verfolgt keine kommerziellen Zwecke und erstrebt keinen Gewinn. Die Organe sind ehrenamtlich t√§tig.

Die Vereinsstatuten und weitere Informationen sind auf verein.swiss.social zu finden.

Zur Bereitstellung dieser Instanz ist der Verein auf Spenden angewiesen.
Wir sind dir dankbar, wenn du die Betriebskosten z.B. mit 2, 3, oder 4 CHF pro Monat unterst√ºtzt.
Die verschiedenen Spendem√∂glichkeiten findest du unter verein.swiss.social/unterstuetzen
Herzlichen Dank!

Impressum / Korrespondenzadresse:

swiss.social
3000 Bern
verein@swiss.social

Gr√ºezi! A server for nice people from Switzerland.

Description:
Long live NAS!

Run by @eriner.

No Authority?

--

All information you transmit to the server should be considered public.

If you give it, I've got it.

Nothing on the Internet is private.

--

FreezePeach.

You assume all liability for what you post.

Don't do anything illegal in the US or government goons are going to send me letters and force me, at gunpoint, to look for information about you.

Description:
Welcome

Welcome to the PHP community on Mastodon! We provide a place for PHP programmers & friends to discuss topics related to the PHP programming language, frameworks, packages, tools, open source, tech, life, and more. First and foremost, we're about building community, and that doesn't always involve technical discussion, so feel free to go off-topic and have fun.

Who's Behind This?

phpc.social is a PHP Commmunity Foundation project. PHP Community Foundation created phpc.social for the public benefit of the PHP community.

How Can I Help?

Thank you for your willingness to help! We appreciate it. Here are some areas we could use your help:

  • Contribute financially by donating through the phpc.social Open Collective project.
  • Volunteer as a moderator‚Äîget to know our community first! A moderator is a position of trust, so we need to know you're legit and planning to stick around.
  • Server administration‚Äîwe manage our own infrastructure, and we‚Äôd love to have your help. Just like being a moderator is a position of trust, so is working on our infrastructure. Hang out, take part in the community, and build trust before asking for access to the servers.

Code of Conduct

If you believe anyone is in physical danger or doing something that is against the law, please notify appropriate emergency services first by calling the relevant local authorities.

The instance is primarily meant for the PHP community and surrounding tech, but posts are not required to be on-topic. As long as it doesn't break the rules, feel free to talk about whatever you want.

Please remember that being on this server is a privilege, and not a right.

The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of phpc.social; they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies.

These policies apply to: posts, profile information and bio, as well as account handles, on phpc.social.

This is a living document, and updates to it will be made if necessary.

  1. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension upon repeated violations:
    1. Advertising of off-topic material for the PHP instance.
    2. Advertising more than once per hour of on-topic material without appropriate Content Warning.
    3. More than one automated post per hour or four per day, excluding posts with a visibility of "unlisted" or "followers only".
    4. Accounts that are primarily intended to post automated messages, unless they are marked "This is a bot account" in account settings and all posts have a visibility of "unlisted" or "followers only."
    5. Persistent trolling, and posts to test the limits of moderation
    6. Promotion of scams (including cryptocurrency and NFTs) or known misinformation/disinformation campaigns, such as anti-vaccination or climate denial.
  2. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and will result in a temporary account suspension, and revocation of access to the service
    1. Nudity, pornography, and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions, without an appropriate Content Warning
    2. Gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions, without an appropriate Content Warning
  3. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:
    1. Racism or advocation of racism
    2. Sexism or advocation of sexism
    3. Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism
    4. Incitement of violence against individuals or groups
  4. The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in immediate and permanent revocation of access to the service:
    1. Sexual depictions of children
    2. Content illegal in Germany and/or France, such as holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism
    3. Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism
  5. Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilising the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviours:
    1. Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed
    2. Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox)
    3. Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling)

These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

Moderation Procedures

Cross-Instance Moderation

First, a few notes on how cross-instance moderation works:

  1. If a remote user is reported from our instance, the report is immediately forwarded to the home of the remote user.
  2. Suspension of a remote user only makes them invisible from, and unable to react to, users on our instance.
  3. Any moderation actions we take with regard to a remote user are not relayed back to that user‚Äôs home instance.
  4. Our view of remote users does not include any information (email, IP address, etc.) that would allow us to proactively block that user from interacting with our instance outside the context of the account they‚Äôre currently on.

With that said, if user A on our instance reports user B on another instance for harassment/hate speech or similar-tier offences, moderators can and should take proactive action comparable to if the harassment had been directed at a user on our instance, even if the reported user has had no interactions with our instance (including follows in either direction). So if the remote user‚Äôs feed is exclusively hate speech, suspend that user.

Proactive vs. Reactive Moderation

Moderators are not obligated, as part of their role, to actively seek out accounts or posts that break our rules or would result in a report. Moderators, like any user of our instance, can use reporting functionality for bad actors that they see during their own use of the platform, and can even take moderation actions directly without going through the report system if they see something sufficiently egregious, though in those cases moderators should post in Discord with what they've done as an audit trail on top of the one built into Mastodon.

With that said, moderators‚Äô primary duty is to assist in resolving reports made by other users in a timely and consistent manner. This means that the role of a moderator is primarily reactive rather than proactive, and we‚Äôre knowingly making the tradeoff of catching things quickly to balance workload on a fully-volunteer moderation staff.

Best Practices

This section contains a set of guidelines on how to best use this instance. They include suggestions for when to use Content Warnings. (Mostly copied from https://blog.chaos.social/rules):

We ask users on phpc.social to keep the following guidelines in mind, in order to foster a considerate and accessible atmosphere. Forgetting about them is not as serious as breaking the instance rules, but repeated malicious unwillingness to follow the best practices will be considered just like breaking a rule.

  • Use content warnings liberally, especially for topics that are potentially disturbing or controversial, or that make life harder for people struggling with addiction or trauma, but also for spoilers.
  • Set the right language for your posts. By default Mastodon will use the interface language to attach to your posts, but if you (for example) have set that to English, and you post in German, then the posts will have "English" attached to them, and translations don‚Äôt work.
  • Add descriptions to images and videos.
  • Provide credit for creative works that are not your own.
  • Don't be a reply guy ‚Äì uninvited comments about another user‚Äôs personal choices, lifestyle, or family are strongly discouraged and may be considered harassment.
  • In discussions, please remain civil, do not insult the people you‚Äôre talking to. Don‚Äôt escalate.

Reporting Harassment

To report harassment, click the three vertical dots (‚ãÆ) on a user's profile and select "Report @user." For urgent concerns, you may contact us at hello@phpcommunity.org.

Policies

Your continued used of phpc.social implies your agreement to our policies. If you disagree with our policies, please discontinue use of our services.

We fully subscribe to and comply with the Mastodon Server Covenant. A number of instance blocks are implemented to comply with the principles of the covenant and to prevent our users from being exposed to content that does not comply with our instance rules.
Short: A server for PHP programmers & friends. Join us for discussions on the PHP programming language, frameworks, packages, tools, open source, tech, life, and more.

Description:
About the rules

Our rules are simple, right?! We will keep this simple.

We welcome everyone on LR, regardless of race, religion or orientation. We welcome debates and conversations, but we do not tolerate personal attacks. The core belief is that we should learn from each other's differences and ideologies. First and foremost, we are all on this instance for one thing: and that is the love for GNU+Linux and Open Source/Free Software.

The people here on LR are a very friendly laid-back group, and we have lots of fun. So come join us! From admins to gamers, from photographers to athletes; we all use GNU+Linux! So bring your hobby or profession, and let's hear about it.

Even the one-eyed one-horned flying purple people eater is welcome here... As long as it uses GNU+Linux...

If you're using GNU+kFreeBSD, GNU+Hurd, BusyBox+Linux, GNU+Linux-Libre or another variant of the GNU system, you're still welcome!

Notice on registration and accounts acceptance

Due to a large amount of spam bots, all registration must be approved. Registration requests without a reason to join may be rejected due to being harder to confirm legitimacy.

Other LinuxRocks Servers

  • PeerTube: https://peertube.linuxrocks.online/
  • XMPP: xmpp://linuxrocks.online (Registration allowed)
  • Jitsi: https://jitsi.linuxrocks.online/ (Registration through XMPP bridge.linuxrocks.online)

If you'd like to donate to LR

  • https://www.patreon.com/linuxrocks
  • https://paypal.me/linuxrocksonline

Code of Conduct

  • Act like an adult.
  • If you want a bunch of legalese to tell you how you should act then maybe we are not a good fit. We are good with being the internet rebels, truly we are. We are happy and we have fun.
Short:
Linux geeks doing what Linux geeks do...

Special thanks go out to Altispeed Technologies for hosting our hardware!
https://www.altispeed.com/

Wir √ºberpr√ºfen die Erforderlichkeit alle zwei Jahre; Ferner gelten die gesetzlichen Archivierungspflichten.', 'Kommentare und Beitr√§ge', 'Wenn Nutzer Kommentare oder sonstige Beitr√§ge hinterlassen, werden ihre IP-Adressen auf Grundlage unserer berechtigten Interessen im Sinne des Art. 6 Abs. 1 lit. f. DSGVO f√ºr 7 Tage gespeichert. Das erfolgt zu unserer Sicherheit, falls jemand in Kommentaren und Beitr√§gen widerrechtliche Inhalte hinterl√§sst (Beleidigungen, verbotene politische Propaganda, etc.). In diesem Fall k√∂nnen wir selbst f√ºr den Kommentar oder Beitrag belangt werden und sind daher an der Identit√§t des Verfassers interessiert.', 'Einbindung von Diensten und Inhalten Dritter', 'Wir setzen innerhalb unseres Onlineangebotes auf Grundlage unserer berechtigten Interessen (d.h. Interesse an der Analyse, Optimierung und wirtschaftlichem Betrieb unseres Onlineangebotes im Sinne des Art. 6 Abs. 1 lit. f. DSGVO) Inhalts- oder Serviceangebote von Drittanbietern ein, um deren Inhalte und Services, wie z.B. Videos oder Schriftarten einzubinden (nachfolgend einheitlich bezeichnet als ‚ÄúInhalte‚Äù).', 'Dies setzt immer voraus, dass die Drittanbieter dieser Inhalte, die IP-Adresse der Nutzer wahrnehmen, da sie ohne die IP-Adresse die Inhalte nicht an deren Browser senden k√∂nnten. Die IP-Adresse ist damit f√ºr die Darstellung dieser Inhalte erforderlich. Wir bem√ºhen uns nur solche Inhalte zu verwenden, deren jeweilige Anbieter die IP-Adresse lediglich zur Auslieferung der Inhalte verwenden. Drittanbieter k√∂nnen ferner so genannte Pixel-Tags (unsichtbare Grafiken, auch als "Web Beacons" bezeichnet) f√ºr statistische oder Marketingzwecke verwenden. Durch die "Pixel-Tags" k√∂nnen Informationen, wie der Besucherverkehr auf den Seiten dieser Website ausgewertet werden. Die pseudonymen Informationen k√∂nnen ferner in Cookies auf dem Ger√§t der Nutzer gespeichert werden und unter anderem technische Informationen zum Browser und Betriebssystem, verweisende Webseiten, Besuchszeit sowie weitere Angaben zur Nutzung unseres Onlineangebotes enthalten, als auch mit solchen Informationen aus anderen Quellen verbunden werden.', 'Vimeo', 'Wir k√∂nnen die Videos der Plattform ‚ÄúVimeo‚Äù des Anbieters Vimeo Inc., Attention: Legal Department, 555 West 18th Street New York, New York 10011, USA, einbinden. Datenschutzerkl√§rung: https://vimeo.com/privacy. WIr weisen darauf hin, dass Vimeo Google Analytics einsetzen kann und verweisen hierzu auf die Datenschutzerkl√§rung (https://www.google.com/policies/privacy) sowie Opt-Out-M√∂glichkeiten f√ºr Google-Analytics (http://tools.google.com/dlpage/gaoptout?hl=de) oder die Einstellungen von Google f√ºr die Datennutzung zu Marketingzwecken (https://adssettings.google.com/.).', 'Youtube', 'Wir binden die Videos der Plattform ‚ÄúYouTube‚Äù des Anbieters Google LLC, 1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA 94043, USA, ein. Datenschutzerkl√§rung: https://www.google.com/policies/privacy/, Opt-Out: https://adssettings.google.com/authenticated.', 'OpenStreetMap', 'Wir binden die Landkarten des Dienstes "OpenStreetMap" ein (https://www.openstreetmap.de), die auf Grundlage der Open Data Commons Open Database Lizenz (ODbL) durch die OpenStreetMap Foundation (OSMF) angeboten werden. Datenschutzerkl√§rung: https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Privacy_Policy ---). Nach unserer Kenntnis werden die Daten der Nutzer durch OpenStreetMap ausschlie√ülich zu Zwecken der Darstellung der Kartenfunktionen und Zwischenspeicherung der gew√§hlten Einstellungen verwendet. Zu diesen Daten k√∂nnen insbesondere IP-Adressen und Standortdaten der Nutzer geh√∂ren, die jedoch nicht ohne deren Einwilligung (im Regelfall im Rahmen der Einstellungen ihrer Mobilger√§te vollzogen), erhoben werden. Die Daten k√∂nnen in den USA verarbeitet werden. Weitere Informationen k√∂nnen Sie der Datenschutzerkl√§rung von OpenStreetMap entnehmen: https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Privacy_Policy.', 'Hinweis und Quellangabe', 'Diese Datenschutzerkl√§rung wurde mit Hilfe eines Datenschutzgenerators erstellt und vom Betreiber an die Gegebenheiten dieser Friendica Instanz angepasst.', 'Erstellt mit Datenschutz-Generator.de von RA Dr. Thomas Schwenke']

oder hier:
PayPal
tun :-)


Oder Ihr bestellt ein Produkt √ºber die folgenden Partnerprogramme:





starte Deine Hetzner Cloud mit 20 ‚Ç¨ Startguthaben √ºber diesen Link:

Hetzner Cloud


Regeln

Da "Geht gut miteinander um" einfacher gesagt als getan ist, haben wir eine (nicht vollst√§ndige) Liste von Verhaltensweisen aufgestellt, die zu einer L√∂schung von Toots und zu einer Blockierung von Accounts f√ºhren k√∂nnen, wenn die Probleme fortbestehen. Insbesondere tolerieren wir nicht:

  • Bel√§stigung, Stalking, Doxxing
  • Verbreitung von Verschw√∂rungstheorien und/oder deren Bef√ºrwortung
  • Rassismus, Sexismus, Beschimpfungen oder deren Bef√ºrwortung
  • Diskriminierung von Geschlechtern und sexuellen Minderheiten oder deren Bef√ºrwortung
  • Gewaltt√§tige nationalistische Propaganda, Nazi-Symbolismus oder F√∂rderung der Ideologie des Nationalsozialismus
  • Leute kontaktieren, die klar gemacht haben, dass sie keinen Kontakt wollen. Dogpiling
  • Nicht markierte Werbung
  • Nicht getaggte oder automatisierte oder √ºberm√§√üige Werbung
  • sexueller Inhalt oder Gewaltdarstellungen
  • Bots, die ohne ihre expliziten Anfragen mit Nutzer interagieren

Bitte melden Sie Verhalten, das Sie st√∂rt an #markusblogde. Das schlie√üt Verhalten von anderen Instanzen mit ein - wir sind sehr gerne bereit, mit Asshole-Instanzen die Verbindung zu unterbrechen.

Basierend auf dem "About" von chaos.social, verf√ºgbar in deren Github-Repository.


Rules

Since "Be excellent to each other" is much easier said than done, we have a (non-exhaustive) list of behaviours that may lead to deletion of toots, and silencing or suspension of accounts, if problems persist. In particular, we do not tolerate:

  • Harrassment, stalking, doxxing
  • Racism, sexism, verbal abuse or advocation thereof
  • Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof
  • Violent nationalist propaganda, Nazi symbolism or promoting the ideology of National Socialism
  • Contacting people who made clear they want no contact. Dogpiling/brigading
  • Untagged advertisement
  • Untagged, or automated, or excessive advertisement
  • sexual content or gore
  • Bots interacting with users without their explicit requests

Please report behaviour that bothers you. That includes behaviour from other instances - we are very willing stop federating with asshole instances.

Based on the about of chaos.social available in their Github-repository.

Description:
Desde IR Soluciones siempre hemos tenido una gran conciencia social y nos ha llevado siempre a aportar en la medida de lo posible nuestro granito de arena a la tierra que nos vio nacer, La Rioja.

Esta vez, hemos querido proporcionar una herramienta social, descentralizada y totalmente libre de censura como alternativa a Twitter.

Mastodon est√° alojado en los servidores de IR Soluciones, y nos encargamos de darle el mantenimiento necesario para el correcto funcionamiento de la plataforma.

Nos comprometemos en la seguridad de los datos, ya que ni monitorizamos ni comerciamos con tu informaci√≥n privada. Tus datos son tuyos y √∫nicamente tuyos.
